newsitem.title: USA: J&L cuts discounts to up prices 5 pct.
newsitem.headline: J&L cuts discounts to up prices 5 pct.

text.p: J&L Specialty Steel Inc said Thursday it will decrease market discounts by three percentage points in an action that will increase prices about five percent for all commodities.
Further, the company said, the current surcharge on nickel, chrome and molybdenum will continue to apply.
J&L said discounts will be reduced on all 200, 300 and 400 series grades of stainless sheet and strip, and continuous mill plate products effective with shipments on or after March 2, 1997.

Discounts on stainless commodity products such as that sold to the pipe and tube manufacturers, rerollers and other end-user customers will also be reduced by three percentage points, the company said. The market discount of hot rolled products will be reduced by three percentage points as well.
